meanings.definition: Engaging in a loud and aggressive argument or fight.
meanings.sent1: The neighbors were outbrawling late into the night, disturbing everyone.
meanings.sent2: The two siblings were outbrawling over who gets to use the TV first.
meanings.sent3: The outbrawling between the cats over the sunny spot on the carpet was quite a spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The outbrawling at the town hall meeting echoed through the streets, showing the intensity of the debate.
meanings.sent5: The outbrawling in the movie scene made the audience jump in their seats.

meanings.definition: To surpass others in brawling or fighting.
meanings.sent1: In the brawl, he outbrawled all his opponents with his swift moves.
meanings.sent2: The champion boxer outbrawled his rival in the ring, winning the match.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel surprisingly outbrawled the big raccoon for the last acorn.
meanings.sent4: She outbrawled her fears and doubts to achieve her dream of becoming a pilot.
meanings.sent5: The outbrawling lion asserted its dominance over the pride with a mighty roar.
